answers.author: James Ley
answers.text:
We have (although suspended for economic reaasons) our PRO (Performance Recognized as Outstanding) program.  This process is managed by an employee rewards and recognition team.  A person (or team) can be nominated for a PRO award (our highest) and if selected their contribution is represented in front of the County Commission, they are given a check for $250 and a day off.  There are awards for heroism (and it doesn't have to be on the job but can be community based), team awards, and a few categories that have to do with operational effectiveness and efficiency.
PRO is the highest level of award.  There are also departmetn based or wrok unit based awards where a person can be recognized at a departmetn or work unit based ceremony.  This is also maanged by employees at the department level.  There is also a thrid level, the NOW award for instantaneous recongiton where someone can simply be acknowledged and given a trinket (pen, cup, hat, T shirt, etc)

author: Jo Ella Hoye
text: Johnson County is reviewing its policy regarding employee bonuses and rewards; this is separate from merit pay or pay for performance .  What types of programs are out there either with or without additional compensation (dollars or time) for the extraordinary achievers?  Do you have an application process, who selects the recipients, what do they receive, how are the programs funded?
title: Request of Information:  Employee Recognition-Rewards
